metadata.case_name: Bombay Municipal Corporation and Municipal Commissioner of Bombay v. Owners of 41 final plots Nos. 106 to 116 and 118 to 147 under Bombay Town Planning Scheme, Santacruz VI

facts.text: Area originally fell within municipal limits of Bandra Municipal Committee.
Bandra Municipal Committee by resolution dated 15th June 1948 declared intention to frame Town Planning Scheme under section 9(1) of Town Planning Act 1915.
Bandra Municipal Committee abolished and area absorbed within limits of Bombay Municipal Corporation, which became local authority.
Government of Bombay sanctioned making of Scheme on 7th May 1951.
Draft scheme prepared and published on 30th April 1953 and sanctioned on 6th May 1954.
Arbitrator appointed on 17th August 1954 to finalize scheme; final scheme published in Official Gazette and forwarded to Tribunal President under section 32.
Town Planning Act 1915 replaced by Town Planning Act 1954 effective 1st April 1957; final scheme adopted under section 90.
Final Scheme sanctioned by Government on 21st August 1958, to come into force 1st January 1959; covers 160 acres divided by Chodbunder Road, concerned with eastern part of 54 acres.
Part of area belonged to N.J. Wadia Trust; Receiver appointed by High Court on 8th February 1948.
Area full of unauthorised huts, sheds, stables and slums; removal one object of Scheme.
Final Scheme provides for new roads, storm-water drains, public sites (School, Playground, Market, Maternity Home); slum removal for proper development.
Receiver transferred 69,625 sq. yards in 41 final plots (Nos. 106-116, 118-147) on 31st July 1962 to respondents 1-3 and one Cardi; Cardi sold to respondents 4-5.
Scheme came into force 1st January 1959; 2-3 years allowed for implementation but no action by Corporation due to slum-dweller resistance.
Respondents called upon Corporation to implement Scheme by removing slums and providing roads/drains; Corporation inactive.
Respondents 1-3 filed Writ Petition No. 474 of 1965 on 13th October 1965 seeking mandamus for roads/drains construction and removal of huts/sheds/stables from 41 plots.
Single Judge granted writs substantially; Appellate Bench confirmed with minor variations on 24th April 1969.

Note 11 to Redistribution Statement: All huts, sheds, stables and temporary structures (including non-conforming) to be removed within one year of Scheme; dishoused given preference in Final Plot No. 16.
Till 1964, no action by Corporation to implement Scheme despite notices from respondents.

legal_issues.text: Whether the Municipal Corporation as local authority owes a duty to remove unauthorised structures (huts, sheds, stables) on private final plots of owners that contravene the Town Planning Scheme.

petitioner_arguments.text: Corporation has primary obligation for roads and drains, and to remove unauthorised structures on lands vested in Corporation for public purpose, but no duty to remove unauthorised structures on private final plots; owners solely responsible.
Writ of mandamus should not be granted at instance of petitioners/respondents as they or predecessors authorised structures and collected rent/fees.

respondent_arguments.text: Corporation as local authority has primary responsibility to implement Scheme, including constructing roads/drains and removing structures contravening Scheme under section 55.

court_reasoning.text: Corporation as local authority wholly responsible for preparation and implementation of development plan and Town Planning Schemes; stringent restrictions on private development post-intention declaration.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Town Planning Act 1954 ensures Schemes made properly and executed effectively.

court_reasoning.text: Under sections 53, 54, 55, local authority vested with powers to evict unauthorized occupants, remove/pull down/alter buildings/works contravening Scheme anywhere in Scheme area; expenses recoverable from defaulter/owner.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Scheme has effect as if enacted in Act (s.51(3)); Note 11 requires removal of temporary structures within one year, enforceable by local authority.

court_reasoning.text: Titles displaced and reconstituted; owner allotted encumbered plot not responsible for eviction; local authority must ensure clear implementation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Frustrates Scheme object if owners bear burden.

court_reasoning.text: Regulation 6 prohibits huts/sheds/temporary structures; Notes to Redistribution Statement (esp. Note 11) reinforce local authority duty.
Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act 1966 repeals but continues old Schemes; corresponding ss.88,89,90 same in intent.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No change in local authority duty.

court_reasoning.text: Mandamus appropriate as statutory duty imposed; respondents not disqualified (no unclean hands; Corporation delayed implementation).
court_reasoning.key_observation: High Court discretion not to be interfered lightly.

holdings.text: Local authority (Corporation) bound to remove huts, sheds, stables and temporary structures on respondents' final plots insofar as they contravene the Scheme or non-compliant with Scheme provisions.

precedents_cited.case_name: The Queen v. The Church Wardens of All Saints, Wigan and Others
precedents_cited.relevance: Mandamus for statutory duty; discretion in granting writ.

precedents_cited.case_name: The Queen v. Garland and Another
precedents_cited.relevance: Mandamus refused for unclean hands; not applicable here.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Town Planning Act, 1954
statutes_cited.relevance: Development plans, restrictions, Scheme effect as Act, vesting, eviction, removal of contravening structures, betterment charges.

statutes_cited.name: Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning Act, 1966
statutes_cited.relevance: Repeal and continuance of old Schemes; corresponding powers for possession handover, eviction, removal.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed confirming High Court order with modification: Corporation to remove within one year all huts/sheds/stables/temporary structures on 41 plots that contravene Scheme or non-compliant; periods to run from Supreme Court judgment date; costs to respondents.
outcome.relief_granted: Mandamus directing Corporation to construct roads/drains and remove contravening structures on private plots.

key_quotes.text: "the local authority may after giving the prescribed notice... remove, pull down, or alter any building or other work in the area included in the scheme which is such as to contravene the scheme"
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core power under s.55(1)(a) for removal anywhere in Scheme area.

key_quotes.text: "Note 11... all huts, sheds, stables and such other temporary structures including those which do not conform to the regulations of the Scheme, shall be removed within one year"
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Scheme provision enforceable by local authority.

key_quotes.text: "it is the primary duty of the local authority to remove all such buildings and works in the whole of the area which contravene the Town Planning Scheme."
key_quotes.speaker: court
